oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Thompson Show (Office of Price Stabilization) - Programs 24 & 25
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Multiple recordings of the Hank Thompson radio show promoted by the Office of Price Stabilization. Labelled as program 24 and program 25. Original broadcast date is unknown. Backed by his Brazos Valley Boys of Amos Hendrick on fiddle (persumably, not mentioned), Johnny Manson on fiddle and vocals (mentioned), Harold Lee "Curly" Chalker on steel guitar (mentioned) and Billy Stewart on bass and vocals (mentioned).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Thompson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Humpty Dumpty Heart [featuring Hank Thompson voiceover] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (00:40) Love Thief (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (02:36) Thompson performs an Office of Price Stabilization commercial break -- (03:40) The Ballad of the Tea Leaves (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (06:38) Please Don't Pass Me By [featuring Johnny Manson vocals] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (08:24) Thompson performs an Office of Price Stabilization commercial break -- (09:23) Huggin' the Keys (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (10:47) Cheaters Never Win (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (13:35) Humpty Dumpty Heart [featuring Hank Thompson voiceover] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (14:42) Humpty Dumpty Heart [featuring Hank Thompson voiceover] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (15:23) The Green Light (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (17:10) Thompson performs an Office of Price Stabilization commercial break -- (18:08) The Lost Highway (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (20:45) Basin Street Blues [featuring Billy Stewart Vocals] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (23:09) Thompson performs an Office of Price Stabilization commercial break -- (23:57) Steel Guitar Jubilee (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (26:22) Cry Baby Heart (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys) -- (28:27) Humpty Dumpty Heart [featuring Hank Thompson voiceover] (Hank Thompson and His Brazos Valley Boys)
